meta.use_limitations: This report is a decision-support diagnostic for leadership development. It is not a psychological, medical, or psychiatric assessment.
meta.data_ethics_note: Results should be interpreted by qualified professionals within an organizational or educational context.
meta.what_it_measures: Decision integrity, resilience under pressure, manipulation awareness, attention control, power handling, and ethical drift resistance.
meta.what_it_does_not_measure: Personality traits, intelligence, emotional disorders, or mental health conditions.
meta.limitations: Results depend on context, pressure level, response accuracy, and situational variables at the time of assessment.

exec.thesis_sentence: Generally stable leadership judgment profile with consistent decision discipline across pressure contexts.

tables.exec_dimensions_rows: Decision Integrity (DI)4.50StrongGenerally stable behavior under typical pressure.Responsibility & Ownership (RP)3.25MixedContext-sensitive; needs guardrails in high-pressure decisions.Manipulation Awareness (MA)4.25StrongGenerally stable behavior under typical pressure.Attention Control (AC)2.67Risk ZoneElevated risk signals; requires targeted intervention.Power & Correction (PR)2.00Risk ZoneElevated risk signals; requires targeted intervention.Ethical Drift Resistance (ED)4.50StrongGenerally stable behavior under typical pressure.

lists.exec_top_assets_li:
• Clear ownership of outcomes and decision follow-through
  • Stable ethical boundary management under pressure
  • Effective prioritization and attention control
lists.exec_top_risks_li:
• Risk of inconsistency when time pressure is extreme
  • Potential blind spots in correction openness under authority pressure
  • Attention overload periods reducing decision quality
lists.exec_30day_actions_li:
• Introduce a decision log for high-stakes calls (criteria + alternatives + consequences)
  • Apply a 2-minute challenge rule: one dissent voice must be heard before final decision
  • Create a red-flag checklist for ethics and governance exceptions
lists.hr_strengths_safeguards_li:
• Clear ownership of outcomes and decision follow-through
  • Stable ethical boundary management under pressure
  • Effective prioritization and attention control

• Risk of inconsistency when time pressure is extreme
  • Potential blind spots in correction openness under authority pressure
  • Attention overload periods reducing decision quality
lists.hr_interventions_li:
• Introduce a decision log for high-stakes calls (criteria + alternatives + consequences)
  • Apply a 2-minute challenge rule: one dissent voice must be heard before final decision
  • Create a red-flag checklist for ethics and governance exceptions
lists.academic_reflection_prompts_li:
• Which dimension shows the highest variability under pressure and why?
  • What would improve correction openness in your decision cycle?
  • Where do you most often trade ethics for speed?

blocks.exec_red_flags: • No critical red flags detected in aggregate scoring.
blocks.hr_risks:
• Risk of inconsistency when time pressure is extreme
  • Potential blind spots in correction openness under authority pressure
  • Attention overload periods reducing decision quality
blocks.academic_frameworks: This profile can be interpreted through governance guardrails, decision-cycle design, and bias-mitigation frameworks.
blocks.academic_cc_details: • Consistency checks: not enabled in 22-item version (planned extension).

academic.profile_statement: A generally stable decision-maker balancing speed with governance discipline.
academic.tradeoffs: Speed and autonomy vs. correction bandwidth and procedural rigor under pressure.
academic.cc_overview: Consistency checks are not enabled in the current 22-item version (planned extension).

hr.role_fit_summary: Strong operational fit; maintain governance guardrails and keep challenge loops active for high-stakes decisions.
